datapackage 0.2.0.9002
  • Reference

Get the Table Schema of a Data Package resource

Source: R/get_schema.R
get_schema.Rd

Returns the Table Schema of a Data Package resource, i.e. the content of its schema property, describing the resource's fields, data types, relationships, and missing values. The resource must be a Tabular Data Resource.

get_schema(resource_name, package)

Arguments

resource_name

Name of the resource.
package

Package object, see read_package().

Value

List object describing the Table Schema.

Examples

# Read datapackage.json file
package <- read_package(system.file("extdata", "datapackage.json", package = "datapackage"))
#> Please make sure you have the right to access data from this Data Package for your proposed use.
#> Follow applicable norms or requirements to credit the dataset and its authors.

# Get table schema of resource "observations"
get_schema("observations", package)
#> $fields
#> $fields[[1]]
#> $fields[[1]]$name
#> [1] "observation_id"
#> 
#> $fields[[1]]$type
#> [1] "string"
#> 
#> $fields[[1]]$constraints
#> $fields[[1]]$constraints$required
#> [1] TRUE
#> 
#> $fields[[1]]$constraints$unique
#> [1] TRUE
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> $fields[[2]]
#> $fields[[2]]$name
#> [1] "deployment_id"
#> 
#> $fields[[2]]$type
#> [1] "string"
#> 
#> $fields[[2]]$constraints
#> $fields[[2]]$constraints$required
#> [1] TRUE
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> $fields[[3]]
#> $fields[[3]]$name
#> [1] "timestamp"
#> 
#> $fields[[3]]$type
#> [1] "datetime"
#> 
#> $fields[[3]]$format
#> [1] "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S%z"
#> 
#> $fields[[3]]$constraints
#> $fields[[3]]$constraints$required
#> [1] TRUE
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> $fields[[4]]
#> $fields[[4]]$name
#> [1] "scientific_name"

#> [1] FALSE
